intro: Pentacalia lindenii, commonly known as the Lindens' pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has small, opposite leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
